wikipedia_page.main: Commander Rupert Arnold Brabner  (29 October 1911 – 27 March 1945) was a British Member of Parliament (MP) who served with the Royal Navy as a pilot in the Second World War and became an ace with 5.5 confirmed kills.

response: * Commander Rupert Brabner (1911–1945), Conservative MP for Hythe 1939–1945 and WWII pilot with the Royal Navy, was born in Loughton
|The Lord Sherwood  and Rupert Brabner || 21 November 1944 || 27 March 1945

link_mentions.page: Records of members of parliament of the United Kingdom
response: |Commander||Rupert Brabner||1911||1945||Killed in a plane crash near the Azores, while leading a delegation to Canada||Conservative Party||Hythe||DSO DSC; Under-Secretary of State for Air (1944-death)

link_mentions.page: List of accidents and incidents involving military aircraft (1945–1949)
response: :RAF Consolidated LB-30 Liberator II AL504, the first Mk. II accepted by the British, was converted to VIP transport for the prime minister and named Commando; it had received a single PB4Y-style fin and rudder modification. The plane was lost over the Atlantic Ocean between the Azores and Ottawa. Lost with the crew were Air Marshal Peter Roy Maxwell Drummond, the RAF's Air Member for Training; Rupert Brabner MP, the Under-Secretary of State for Air, and Air Ministry deputy undersecretary John Abraham.
* Rupert Brabner, DSO DSC (1911–1945), RN, Fleet Air Arm World War II pilot ace, MP for Hythe (1939–1945), Under Sec. of State for Forces. killed in flying accident in Canada (Who's Who)

link_mentions.page: List of members of London County Council 1937–1949

response: *The Conservatives selected a London County Councillor, Rupert Brabner, to defend the seat.
Rupert Brabner served as a junior Government Minister. He died on active service with the RNVR early in 1945.

The Under-Secretary of State for Air Rupert Brabner DSO DSC, his deputy Sir John Abraham KBE CB, and the Air Member for Training Air Marshal Sir Peter Roy Maxwell Drummond KCB DSO & Bar OBE MC RAF needed to fly to Canada with other dignitaries to attend a ceremony marking the closure of the British Commonwealth Air Training Plan. Winston Churchill's former personal transport Commando was assigned as the VIP aircraft.
*Rupert Brabner (1911–1945), British politician and war pilot
